PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire:

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual, no matter how closely the same experiences as another, can be expected to answer all questions equally. Some of the questions have been omitted from this questionnaire because they are not applicable to everyone; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Use only the space given for answers, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Use only the space given for answers, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914 and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Western Canadian Archives Questionnaire No. 7, entitled "Pioneer Diet: What Did They Eat?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here and one will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

( ) All questionnaires
( ) Pioneer health conditions
( ) Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
( ) Pioneer housing
( ) Pioneer education and churchwork
( ) Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.

SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A NOTE ON EXPLANATION TO THE PERSON COMPLETING THIS QUESTIONNAIRE

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who has lived in Saskatchewan has personal experience of the pioneer years who has not been born in this province or not. If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled Pioneer Diet: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Eat? is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ) and one will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please rank the ones you would be willing to answer.

( ) All Questionnaires
( ) Pioneer health conditions
( ) Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
